alert.note: Alert for Howard; Mitchell; Winneshiek (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 7:28AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Mitchell, Howard, northwestern Winneshiek, western Winona, southeastern Olmsted, southeastern Mower and Fillmore Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 727 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Plainview to near Spring Valley to near St. Ansgar. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Dover around 735 AM CDT. St. Charles and Altura around 740 AM CDT. Lewiston and Lime Springs around 745 AM CDT. Stockton around 750 AM CDT. Cresco around 755 AM CDT. Rushford around 800 AM CDT. Ridgeway around 805 AM CDT. Decorah around 810 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Forestville State Park, Toeterville, Vernon Springs, Nordness, Isinours, County Roads T 54 And A 31, Fillmore, Rushford Village, Osage Spring Park and Pilot Mound. This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 222 and 250. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
